intro: Potentilla glandulosa subsp. ashlandica, commonly known as Ashland sandspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with glandular dots, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, disturbed habitats.
